intro: Tiedemannia ternata, commonly known as the three-leafed greenbriar, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. The plant features trifoliate leaves, with each leaflet being oval-shaped and serrated along the edges. Its small, white flowers bloom in clusters during the spring and are followed by red, fleshy berries that attract birds. Botanically, it is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in the genus Tiedemannia, which belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae.
